page.title: 14Nature South of Oakley 1
page.content: {Deer}are occasionally seen along the road between Oakley and the motorway. Foxes, rabbits, badgers,hegdehogs and many small{mammals}are common in the copses and woodland. A large variety of wild{birds}inhabit almost every part of the area. Jay, woodpecker, magpie, wren, jackdaw, treecreeper, owl, and sparrow hawk are among those frequently seen. Chalk downland wild {flowers}grow in abundance around Peak Copse and the motorway south of the Basingstoke Golf Course. Identified species are campian, agrimony, rosebay willowherb,clover,field madder, poppy, sorrel and common hawkweed.In the same area large numbers of{butterflies}and {moths}were seen during a leisurely walk in early July. These included six spot burnetts, wooded whites,meadow browns, ringlets, red admirals, small and large whites and tortoiseshells.
